data.description: This document defines the architecture of In-game advertising (IGA) Enabler. This architecture is based on the requirements listed in the IGA Requirement Document [OMA-MOBAD-RD]. The IGA Enabler architecture is to support interfacing Game-side and Advertisement-side. The architecture defines server-side and client-side IGA Enabler components, the interface(s) between them and the interface(s) exposed by those components to some entities that serves IGA Service.  Therefore, IGA AD has the scope as followings:  IGA entities: functions for IGA service itself  Interface to GS-CSI: Interfacing functions from/to Game Services Client-Server Interface Enabler  Interface to MobAd: Interfacing functions from/to Mobile Advertising Enabler
The scope of this document is limited to the Enabler Release Definition of IGA 1.0 according to OMA Release process and the Enabler Release specification baseline listed in section 5.

This Requirement Document (RD) contains use cases and defines the requirements for the IGA (In-Game Advertising) Enabler. The following areas will be covered in this RD: • In-game advertising models • Gamer Interactivity of Advertisements • Game advertising Metrics The IGA Enabler will reuse as much as possible existing technologies. Some requirements may be covered by other OMA Enablers.
